# Project Management Program FAQs

## 

Can you describe the Project Management Program’s criteria for accepting projects?

Please refer to the following link: Criteria to Qualify for Project Management Services

## 

What is the process to apply for the Project Management Program?

  * Criteria to Qualify for Project Management services
  * Apply for Project Management Services



## 

How much time will be saved by entering the Project Management Program?

While a time savings cannot be guaranteed, past projects have experienced more efficient processing due to enhanced focus on mutual accountability in communications, quality and schedule.

## 

Is there a fee to enter the Project Management Program?

There is no fee at this time, but this may change in the future.

## 

Where can I find out about other projects in the Project Management Program?

Some projects are discussed on our testimonial page. Please contact the Project Management Program at **703-324-1780 , TTY 711** to discuss other example projects with a project manager.

## 

What phases of the development process are included in the Project Management Program?

The program can apply to any or all remaining phases of a project that Fairfax County reviews, approves and permits, depending on the approach used. The team will work with the applicant to identify appropriate phases for Project Management involvement.

## 

What authority does the project manager have over the various reviewing agencies?

None. The project manager’s duties are to facilitate communication and coordinate between different stakeholders. Each individual agency coordinator/lead is responsible and makes decisions for that agency.
